Replies.Reply: Carol from the museum called. She's sending architect's sketches of the wing...
No.  He just said he'd be at Leo's in the Haight.  At noon.  Maria hands him a slip of paper, lingers, awaiting explanation...
Business as usual...
I called them off two years ago, David.  You'd kicked the heroin, you'd left the ashram, you were windsurfing somewhere in Central America...
Look, are you in trouble, is there anything you need?  You can't have gone through the trust fund...
You didn't bake me a cake, did you?
Consumer Recreation Services.  OK...
Just a cheesebur... how'd you find this place?
OK, OK, I'll give them a call...
I always call on your birthday.
Oh, the usual, big party, circus clowns, naked lady in a cake...
It wasn't a trick question. Thirty-eight, I thought that might be a-- a difficult year for you...
Why do I call you...
Mm-hmm, couple days a week...
He asked about you.  He's on a new kick, some personal improvement cult.
I'll drink to that.  SCHUYLER raises his champagne glass to the TV, his birthday done.
Please, Jim, cut the hard-to-get shit.  I've got the afternoon free, I'll take your silly tests.
I get that all the time.  Feingold smiles tightly and leads Schuyler back into his office.
So I'm supposed to sign up for a game when I don't know the rules, I don't know the object, I don't know how much it costs...
This round's on me.  Schuyler moves casually toward the men--
Great thing about golf, the way it takes you out of your life...
No is not an option.  If you fail to recognize that, I'll find ten other law firms in the yellow pages that can get the job done--  CHIRP.  Schuyler's CELL-PHONE has started RINGING during the above.
This is Cynthia at CRS...
--so I don't have time for--
Thank you for thinking of CRS.  CLICK and a DIAL TONE.  Schuyler shuts the phone and replaces it in his pocket, his mind suddenly far away from the meeting at hand.
No, nothing.  Sorry, Bob.
So were there any more questions, or may I assume it's under control...
Hello!  What are you doing here?  THE BODY doesn't stir.  He approaches gingerly.
Wonderful.  You OK?  You dead?  He crouches by the wino, winces at a strong smell, covers his nose.
Shit, shit, shit...

This might be a good time to lay out a few ground rules, help you enjoy your adventure.  You've received the first key.  There will be others. Pay attention-- you never know where you'll find 'em, you never know when you'll need 'em, so keep 'em with you at all times...
Our office is closed.  Please call back during business hours.
I'm expecting a package with some documents.  Did it arrive?  The man shakes his head, Schuyler, exasperated, whips out his cell-
I'll take my chances.
Up my ass, very funny...
I don't-- OK.  OK, you're with CRS...
So the game, it's just a screen, to blow this deal...
Like hell you aren't.  How did you get my brother involved, that's unforgivable.
Everything seems to be in order. Please disregard my last comments.
Listen, I quit.
Let's get this over with... Where's the next key?  Does she have it?  Ronnie stares, uncomprehending... Schuyler goes after Christine.
Is there anything I can do?  CHRISTINE ignores him, all attention on saving this guy's life...
As a matter of fact...
It's a little hard to explain...
I don't know the rules, if there are any, but it seems the obvious move usually backfires...
Damn it...
Wrong key...
They're rubber.  Hold onto me, I'll get us out of here.
What's your favorite color?
We're getting somewhere...
Mm, a different kind of fun.
Probably knew you'd play Good Samaritan for that guy, drag me along-- but they could have hired an actor for that, less of a risk...

My apologies, I'll have it taken care of.  Help yourself to the fridge.  He points to a MINI-FRIDGE, shuts the door, a moment later we hear WATER RUNNING.  She looks around the office, letting down her facade.  She seems quite impressed, and intimidated, by the place.
Manage investments, some venture capital, I'm on the board of a number of publicly traded companies...
Look, I hope you haven't been too put out... I could probably get you another job, I have a stake in a couple of restaurants--
They planted those keys!  I don't know what the hell they're for--  Schuyler tries hard to be rational, but David is over the edge.
Six three six Mission, please.

Relax, pal, you'll get where you're going.  The cabbie turns IN PROFILE for a moment.  He appears to be wearing a HEARING AID, a round piece of plastic, a tiny WIRE disappearing into his shirt.  And there's something familiar about his face.
We do it all for you!  We're the best friends you got, no one ever worked so hard to make you feel alive... but you gotta let it happen...
Have a nice day...
I have to get in touch with the police.
Uh, no.  I'm fine.  These fit...
I'm supposed to carry a fucking hatchet around...?  Relax.  I don't want it.  He drops the AXE and the COFFIN into the water with a SPLASH--  95PT. THEY GO UNDER and DISAPPEAR...
Let's go.  Seventh floor.
He likes Chinese food...
Oh, God--  SCHUYLER tosses the picture aside, moves into his living room--
Oh you're always so negative...
You people are insane...
Don't worry about him, he's just playing his own game-- at a more advanced level, you might say...
Sky, I just came to say good- bye... Too bad it didn't work out, better luck next time.  Uh, there might be a few loose ends for you to tie up, but remember--
LATE AFTERNOON, the COMPANY LIMO pulls up and Schuyler emerges.
A friend's dog-- he'd been hit by a car, I drove him to the vet...
Mr. Kaminsky?  Schuyler Van Orton--  MR. KAMINSKY Is that a name?  Look, I'm kinda busy.
You have a daughter named Christine?  I'm afraid she might be in danger.  MR. KAMINSKY narrows his eyes at him as we hear--
No, I thought they were trying to frame me, they planted evidence...
I was worried about you.  I wanted to see you again.

Don't touch me.  His tone alarms her-- he stares at her with hatred.  A silent BEAT between them, each tries to assess the new situation.  She realizes he's onto her.  She swallows, makes a quick decision.  Suddenly she leans close to him, reaching around him to SHUT OFF the table lamp.
God damn it...
--you can come out now, assholes--  He moves toward the front door, a panicked Christine behind him--
Oh, now I suppose they're going to--  THE WINDOWS BLOW IN, GUNFIRE, Christine TACKLES HIM and pulls him to the ground as--
How the hell did they think they were gonna get my money?
Do I look like I'm kidding?
Sorry, this place hasn't been cleaned in a while.  My dad built it himself, spent a lot of time here alone.
Rotten carpenter...
Just-- private joke...
Mm, plus I'm a helluva lot more gullible than he ever was...
It's me, Schuyler... I got your message...
I've been on the phone all morning... your funds are intact, nothing's changed, there's been no activity whatsoever...
Oh, God...
What are they paying you, Robert?
We have to get out of here!  Christine approaches him with a fresh cup of coffee, which he sips.
OK, they've gotten to him.  OK.
Christine!!
Why...
Please, help me, I'm an American!
Yeah, well I, I seem to have lost my passport...
Huh, close enough...
No.  Fuck you... I'm going to live...
David...
Thank God... Listen, I know you put them onto me-- but I understand, we're both victims of this thing...
No, David-- please...
OK, there's the C...
Come on, you're not going to put me through all this shit and then kill me on a fucking train, it won't look like a suicide...
Hello Elizabeth...
I need your help, you're the only one left, the only one I can trust--
Yes I was.  Sometimes I think I'm being punished for my sins, I mean, there has to be a reason...
I can't find the right channel...
I don't think coffee is safe.  Schuyler opens the bottle and drinks straight from it thirstily.
Crisis people.  Crisis people?
You bastard!  You fucking bastard!
Fuck you!  THE TV IMAGE WIDENS, a COMMERCIAL ACTRESS rubs Feingold's neck.
Sure, some aspirin--  The actress CLUCKS her tongue, shakes her head.
He's an actor...
He's just a fucking actor...
Damn it!  Schuyler stalks away from her, finds himself facing the wall of signed photographs--
Isn't there any way we can get in touch with him now...?  I see...
Bill Fisher, hi!  I really admire your work...

Really-- I don't know.  Improvise.  Go!  183A.  I N T .   C R S   G A R A G E  -  N I G H T  The station wagon stops at the bottom of the ramp.  A BEEFY GATE GUARD behind glass glares at Feingold, who waves timidly.  The STEEL GATE RISES and the station wagon drives in.  THE STATION WAGON parks near an elevator bank; a handful of CARS, a few white CRS SECURITY VEHICLES and VANS parked nearby.  Feingold climbs out, trying hard not to look scared.  ELEVATOR DOORS OPEN and a beefy, frightening-looking SECURITY MAN in a suit steps out.
I watched him die...
Back off.  Everybody back off.  He uses his knee in the small of her back to push her brutally toward the nearest door, she CHOKES and GASPS.
It's my gun...
Of course you did.  So you could kill me or, or frame me for murder--
They?  We?

Stop.  Fucking.  With my head!  Schuyler runs a hand over his sweating forehead, the gun TREMBLING in his hand.  Christine's regaining control.  Schuyler's mind whirls, he GROANS, almost crying as he considers for the first time that she might be telling the truth.  She steps closer.
You're not gonna die.  I'm here, you're not gonna die...
Fun...
Nice to meet you, Susan...
Look, I have to know.  Who's really in charge?  She shrugs, blows a SMOKE RING and sticks her finger through it.
I know, Liz, I've been an idiot, and I'm sorry...
Yeah-- I'm good, really.  Happy to be alive... Listen, it's great to see all of you, thanks for coming--
Sorry.  She moves off as Schuyler tries to order, raising a finger--
What?...
Uh-huh sure, here you go.  She puts her hand into her side pocket, pulls it out with her middle finger extended, moving away from him in a hurry.
You really are insane!  SCHUYLER leans close to look at the man.  ON THE MAN'S FACE-- sweating, contorted, unnaturally pale, his eyes rolling back as he GAGS his last...
731-5723-- yeah, thanks--
Try!  We hear the STRIKING OF A MATCH, there's some ORANGE LIGHT--
I don't get it.

OK, I'm puzzled.  Where are we?  SCHUYLER has found a STEEL DOOR with a GLOWING RED SIGN:  EMERGENCY USE ONLY.  He yanks it open and a PAIL swings down, dumping WATER on his head.  He's facing a BRICK WALL through the door.  CHRISTINE can't help but LAUGH, then YELPS in pain as the match burns her fingers.  LIGHTS another.  Schuyler flips open his phone.
Of course.  I have no idea what you're talking about.
Leave me alone!
Help!  SCHUYLER follows.  FALLING himself.  They try to reach toward each other for purchase, but it's no good, the slope is getting steeper.
...Blue?  He takes off the glasses, puts them on her.  She looks around.
Wow... OK, this is kinda cool.  Hey!  SCHUYLER slips the glasses off her, puts them back on.
Well, that was pointless... but different... kind of fun...
Who says I want to play?
I'm not much of a waitress, really.
Kind of a turn-on, you know?
I didn't mean-- just, the danger...
Tattoos...
You dry clean your sweatshirts...
No... unfortunately.

I look like a slob, let me change.  She hurries upstairs.  Schuyler sighs, wondering what the hell he's doing here.  He glances at a VIRGIN MARY statue, squints-- then unscrews the head, it's a decanter.  He takes a sniff and puts it back with a bemused expression.  He takes another sniff, noticing something else in the air...
Mm-hmm, First Communion.
OK, I know a good place we could go and like, be alone...
It's a beautiful night, isn't it?  Schuyler comes up beside her, she nods for him to look outside--
You idiot!  Come on!
Get away from there!!
God, wake up, it's a con game!  THE GARAGE DOOR OPENS, Christine pulls Schuyler against a wall--  A "PARAMEDIC" charges out of the shadows, pulling a handgun--
Watch out!!
No cops, I got an outstanding warrant.
Mail fraud.  I'll get nailed, but you'll never be able to prove a thing.
Heard about this big swindle and--
You don't believe me, check your bank accounts.  Listen, that night in your office, remember?  I downloaded files off your computer while you were in the shower...
I'm sorry.  They already did your brother, I guess they figured you for a family of suckers...
Bet you haven't really been taking care of business the past few days, huh?  This "game," the psych shit about your dad going sui...
All of it was just to buy time, keep you from paying attention...
Money isn't everything, right?  Schuyler is seething, clutching the trunk lid for a beat, then SLAMS it hard when she steps back, making her jump.
We needed you to call your banks. Cellular calls can be intercepted, rerouted, y'know.

All those calls to Switzerland and Chase Manhattan-- you were talking to our people.  See, we were still missing a lotta pieces-- access codes, passwords, stuff even Plyrnpton didn't have-- but now we have I everything.  I guess you are pretty fucking stupid-- but thanks.  He CLAWS at her helplessly with a GROAN, but misses.  His glasses fall off, he collapses again.
It's over.  Just let go...
What are you talking about?
Well, look, I'm sure it's just another stunt-- that can't be real, taste it.
Schuyler this is all fake, tricks, it's all part of the game--
THINK ABOUT IT!!  They followed you every step of the way, the cab, in the trunk, we had a diver--
You're all right, it's OK, just relax...

Please... when you open the door, the game ends... just open the door... Bill Fisher's out there, he's fine, nobody got hurt.  Why would we do the crazy things we did, if it wasn't part of a game?  We thought you knew that...
Oh God.  I blew it... we blew it...
That stupid...
You fucking psycho, you piece of shit, how could you--  SCHUYLER gently lowers his brother and rises, like a zombie now.
Can I have a puff?  He gives her a DRAG on his cigar.
God?
You're divorced...
All over.  Nowhere in particular.
You can't still be mad about the hash brownies...

It's a bomb.  Open it!  Schuyler shrugs, opens the envelope and shakes out--  A BUSINESS CARD in BLUE and ORANGE:  "CONSUMER RECREATION SERVICES." The C, R and S are HIGHLIGHTED, a PHONE NUMBER at the bottom.
No, it's nothing like that. They're a business, they're for real... They guarantee just one thing-- you won't be bored.  Schuyler gives him a bored, blank look.  David throws up his hands.
"A delicate liquidation," God, you would do this...
Go away.  She curls her lip and departs before Schuyler can open his mouth.
I know.  David WINKS, puts a finger to his lips-- not another word.  CLOSE as Schuyler slips the brightly-colored CARD into his pocket.
Oh shit, oh SHIT they must be following us--  He cranks his neck around, looking for pursuers.  Schuyler looks at him for a beat-- BANG!  He almost loses control of the wheel.
They're shooting at us!
I don't know, out of boredom, to get back at me--

Fuck you!  David SLUGS HIM in the face, Schuyler staggers back, clutches his BLEEDING nose.  David runs, full tilt, into the woods near the Japanese Tea Garden.  SCHUYLER pursues amidst the trees and vegetation, running out of breath, calling after David, who's vanished.  He leans against a tree, PANTING, dabbing at his bleeding nose with a SCRAP OF TISSUE from his pocket.  He hears a PHONE RINGING, moves toward it, emerging through bushes near the ACADEMY OF SCIENCE...
Hello Sky...
Oh, Schuyler, there is no game.  It was just a fantasy of mine, a self-
Oh, man, stop fucking with me! You know the game doesn't exist...
Can you see?  ON SCREEN-- a golf ball rolls on a green and PLOPS into the cup.
SKY, NOOOO!!
Admit it, you weren't bored...

Like they'd really leave a loaded gun lying around.  They went over the whole place with a metal detector, then packed that thing with blanks.  They turn a corner into the main lobby, Schuyler absently pockets the gun, looks up in wonder...
Very good...
Mine was a little weirder.  Tell you about it sometime.  David pulls out A COLORED ENVELOPE, slips it into Schuyler's shirt.
The bill.  It's itemized.  Don't bother opening it now...
It's... a radio...
Schuyler, try and listen to me.  I love you, I always have, I always will.  And maybe this is... good.
Hello?  Hi, hon, I'm OK... um, could I call you back...?
Are you on drugs?
This gentlemen says he has an appointment, but...
Van Orton, huh?  I'll take him.
Sorry about the chaos, we're still in the process of moving...
I can't remember the last time I ate in a restaurant, all I do is work...
Application, MMPI and TAT tests, financial statement...
Want some?  Tung Hoy, best in Chinatown...
The tests serve a threefold purpose.
David was-- impressive, one of the better I've seen.  But frankly, I can see you're not the type.
I don't mean anything personal by it--
The ultimate fucking game.  I wish I could tell you more, but it's different every time.
Ms. Nelson, are you busy?  We need someone to run Mr. Van Orton.  MS. NELSON This way, sir...

I'll catch up with you after the physical.  Schuyler reacts-- a physical?  He throws up a hand and follows the woman into the hall.  Alone now, Feingold cracks a fortune cookie and glances at the slip of paper inside.  He furrows his brow with concern at the fortune-- then tosses it aside.
Sorry to keep you waiting, a client's head exploded...
Looks promising at this point. You test well, you're in decent shape for someone in your tax bracket... Hm, some resistance to the psych questions, but we got the general idea...
You'd have to ask our billing department... the price varies.  But our service comes with a guarantee.
Mm, that's right-- you're a left-
We'll be in touch.  Feingold gently shuts the door on schuyler's face.
Oh please... I got my kids here...
Hey, everyone-- here's a twenty!
Of CRS?  Christ, nobody knows, nobody gets the big picture--
No way, it's too dangerous.
You shot her!?  No!
Qh God no...
Oh God.  I thought you could handle it.  All the tests... they said you could handle it...
God, why-- there was no point.  It was supposed to be fun...
It's not strictly legal, so don't tell anyone...
Uh-oh.  Time to piss...
I played my game in New York...
...last time I played Pebble, I swore I'd never pick up a club again...
Worth it... Gee, I dunno... they did save my fucking life...

Look, I don't know you, you don't know me, but... I hit a certain point, nothing meant anything.  My work, the wife and kids-- hell with 'em, I was sick of it all, y'know?  But CRS... they changed everything.  "Are they for real?"  Who cares, maybe nothing is.
Good luck, pal.  You'll need it.  Schuyler stares after the two men dubiously as they move off.
Wait'll you try level two...
Joke.  The RASTA SLAPS his back, Schuyler instinctively looks over his shoulder for a gag message.

Excuse me.  Excuse me!  Postponing the Baer-Grace meeting is out of the question.  Schuyler gets on a plane for Washington tomorrow morning at seven with every contract, every side agreement, the complete closing package!
There's clearly a civil case once we locate the defendant...
Y'know, Sky, things are quiet since the closing-- you could take some time off.  SCHUYLER sighs and nods, closes the car door and waves good-bye.
What is this, Sky?  We got a call from your brother, said there was a surprise party...
You've reached CRS...
Jah Love mon, dat's the key, dat's the key...
Wha's that, mon?  I didna hear you.  Schuyler is pursuing the man, walking faster and faster.
So try looking at it through rose-
I'm giving you an overview of our little operation!  You gotta see the new breed of high yield saplings...
You've been planning this for months, haven't you?  Sandbagging me like this, selling us for scrap...
That's not how you play the game.  SCHUYLER turns on him, a suspicion forming...
Up your ass?
Um... sorry to interrupt.  We've been having some trouble with this fax, so they re-sent the material.
Oh and Mr. Van Orton-- are these yours?  The pilot found 'em on the floor of the chopper...
Chrissy, just apologize...
Shouldn't swim in the Bay, you could get hepatitis.  Schuyler nods, looking around, recovering from the shock.
Do you need any help?  His back is turned as the girl climbs down, opens her raincoat--
I just got hired to show you a good time!  C'mon please get off me...
Y'know, Fantasy Girls.  They said you had this wild fantasy, I should just wait in the boat...
Doncha want your thing?  I'm supposed to give you this, this key thingie...
I'm a little confused as to motive here.  You said your brother sent you to these people...
So the waitress was in on it--
Yo, Schuyler, wait up--  He's through the door.  The WHINE OF THE DETECTOR continues as we--
My guess is this Feingold guy's using an alias... is there anything else you can tell us about him?  Schuyler spots an empty CHINESE FOOD CARTON crumpled in the corner.
I just spoke with his lawyer Plympton, he thinks Van Orton's having a nervous breakdown, we should probably hold onto him till his people can get down here...
I'm calling from the Claremont Hotel in Berkeley... we have your American Express card, you left it at the check-in desk...
Mr. Van Orton.  Here's your credit card... and the maid found this under the bed...
We'd just as soon you took it with you, in any event... and in the future, you might consider choosing another hotel for your...
Out to Concord...
Just-- I thought you followed us there.  There was a black 500SE behind us the whole way, I just assumed...
Of course, sir.  It was a white house, I remember... big tree in the front... with one of those, you know, tire swings...
It wasn't you, sir.
Triple A changed your tire... bad blow-out was it?  Anyone hurt?  Schuyler shakes his head.  They've reached his MBZ.
Oh.  Just... we were a little curious about the mess in the back...
They say I gotta confiscate your card...
"I am an American.  I am an idiot.
This will buy you a plane ticket.
This man says he can help you...

The medication seems to be helping. Unfortunately we're going to have to transfer your brother to a public institution in a few days, his funds are entirely exhausted-- unless you're prepared to take responsibility...
Wait here--
Many customers, very busy, I don't know, I don't know--
Stop that, what you doing?!  Schuyler's already leapt off the counter, bolts out the door.
You're not authorized to be here.  HE FIRES-- Schuyler glimpses a SPRAY OF BLOOD, Feingold collapses.

You're a dead man.  Schuyler looks one more time at the elevator panel--  AT BASE OF PANEL, a gold keyhole.  CLOSER-- the letters CRS are printed beneath it, very small.  SCHUYLER shakes his head-- it couldn't be; but what else can he do?

I'll call an ambulance.  The Rasta dashes downstairs.  Schuyler backs away, drops the gun, staggers over to David.  He's GASPING for breath.  CRS EMPLOYEES give the brothers a wide berth, move toward Feingold and Christine.
That look on your face up there?
